==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|でん|し|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Appears to be a [[coinage]] in Japan from {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=てんし'|電|tr1=den|t1=lightning, electricity|子|tr2=shi|t2=small thing, particle}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|でんし|y=go|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|でんし}}

# [[electron]]

====Usage notes====
In compounds or when followed by the possessive particle {{l|ja|の}}, this can be translated as either {{m|en|electron}} or {{m|en|electronic}}. Note, however, that in both cases this word in Japanese is still a noun.

====Coordinate terms====
* {{ja-r|陽子|ようし}}: a [[proton]]
* {{ja-r|中性子|ちゅうせいし}}: a [[neutron]]
